bank

Interface Bank


  • public interface Bank
    The Bank interface describes the functionality of a bank. Using this interface, new accounts can be created and existing accounts can be closed.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Dominik Gruntz
    See Also:
    Account

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean closeAccount(String number)
      Closes an account.
      String createAccount(String owner)
      Creates a new account.
      Account getAccount(String number)
      Returns a particular account given the account number.
      Set<String> getAccountNumbers()
      Returns a set of the account numbers (of type String) of all currently active accounts.
      void transfer(Account a, Account b, double amount)
      Transfers the given amount from account a to account b.

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        String createAccount(String owner)
              throws IOException
        Creates a new account. As result, the method returns the account number of the generated account or null, in case that the account could not be generated. An owner may own several accounts.
        Parameters:
        owner - name of the owner
        Returns:
        account number of generated account or null, if the account could not be generated
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • closeAccount

        boolean closeAccount(String number)
              throws IOException
        Closes an account. Only accounts with balance zero may be closed. Calling method isActive on a closed account will return false. As result, the method returns whether the account could be closed or not.
        Parameters:
        number - number of the account to be closed
        Returns:
        true, if the closing was successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • getAccountNumbers

        Set<String> getAccountNumbers()
                       throws IOException
        Returns a set of the account numbers (of type String) of all currently active accounts.
        Returns:
        set of account numbers of all active accounts
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • getAccount

        Account getAccount(String number)
            throws IOException
        Returns a particular account given the account number. If the account number is not valid, null is returned as result. The returned account may be passive.
        Parameters:
        number - number of the account
        Returns:
        account with the account number as specified or null, if such an account was never created and does not exist.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • transfer

        void transfer(Account a,
              Account b,
              double amount)
       throws IOException,
              IllegalArgumentException,
              OverdrawException,
              InactiveException
        Transfers the given amount from account a to account b.
        Parameters:
        a - account to withdraw amount from
        b - account to deposit amount
        amount - value to transfer
        Throws:
        InactiveException - if one of the two accounts is not active
        OverdrawException - if the amount is greater than the balance of account a
        IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is negative
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs
        Preconditions:
        amount ≥ 0
